avalancheActivity.comment: Small slab avalanche was discovered in Bláfjöll on the 22nd of February along with many minor cornice collapses and movement.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A little bit of new dry snow is on top of older freeze-thaw snow since early this week. Instability has been discovered between these snow types that could develop in the frost this weekend. Rain and thawing in the mountains is expected for Monday that will increase instability.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in thaw since Saturday. This old snow is expected to be generally homogeneous and stable in most places. If should stiffen and strengthen even more in cold temperatures. The little new dry snow on top may bond poorly with underlying freeze-thaw snow. An extended column test in Bláfjöll 22nd of feb. gave a fracture that propagated at medium load on a slush layer between stiffer slabs. In these conditions, large avalanches are not expected but gullies and depressions that have gathered much new snow can be dangerous. Thawing weather on Monday will temporarily compromise stability in the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow has fallen this week around the country and unstable wind slabs could have formed in various aspects. Weak layers have been found in Tröllaskagi and both wet and dry slabs have been falling this weekend in the region. Slabs have also been falling in the Eastfjords as wind slabs have grown in various aspects. A thawing weather on Monday will temporarily compromise snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Unstable wind slabs have formed widely this week. Weak layers are in the snowpack at Tröllaskagi and slabs have been falling in the Eastfjords. Thaw and rain on Monday compromises stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Lægir og frystir með sunnudeginum. Talsverðri úrkomu er síðan spáð í suðlægum áttum á mánudag með hlýindum.  Áframhaldandi vestan éljabakkar á þriðjudag með auknu frosti.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many small avalanches released in Kirkjubólshlíð, probably in the rain the night before Wednesday 20.2. The largest avalanche stopped 50 m above the road. Small sluffs released in the area in warm weather and sunshine last weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow that fell after Wednesday may have formed unstable wind slabs on top of stiff and generally stable snow, especially in S-W aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The weather was warm from Saturday to Tuesday and the snow subsided and partly melted. Weak layers in the snowpack seem to have gained strength and the old snow should now be generally stiff and stable. New snow that fell in the second half of the week, especially on Thursday, and drifted in strong NE winds can however have formed new unstable wind slabs on top, especially in S-W aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow has fallen this week around the country and unstable wind slabs could have formed in various aspects. Weak layers have been found in Tröllaskagi and both wet and dry slabs have been falling this weekend in the region. Slabs have also been falling in the Eastfjords as wind slabs have grown in various aspects. A thawing weather on Monday will temporarily compromise snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Unstable wind slabs have formed widely this week. Weak layers are in the snowpack at Tröllaskagi and slabs have been falling in the Eastfjords. Thaw and rain on Monday compromises stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Kalt og þurrt um helgina. Snýst í hvassa suðlæga átt aðfaranótt mánudags, fyrst með ákafri snjókomu en fer svo í slyddu og rigningu. Kólnar á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Few small slab avalanches fell in Ólafsfjörður and by Ólafsfjarðarvegur on Thursday when it snowed intensely in NW winds and later the same day when NNE winds picked up. Around 300m wide slab was seen in Burstabrekkudalur on the 19th of february that likely fell in the warming episode last weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense snowfall on Thursday morning in northerly winds with sleet or rain at sea level triggered a few slabs. It kept on snowing in the mountains throughout Friday in N winds and wind slabs in S facing hills have grown. A warming episode is expected for Monday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow settled in the warming episode last weekend but still a weak layer is persistent in the mountains. Stability tests in Klettahnjúkurm from 24.2. showed a sudden planar failure at 37 cm depth where a faceted layer was situated under a layer of ice. Little snow was added in a short period of NE-winds on Wednesday morning. On Thursday morning we had intense snowfall in easy NW-winds but in the afternoon in strong NNA winds with sleet or rain at sea level. Continous minor snowfall dominated Friday but it will get dry and cold during the weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow has fallen this week around the country and unstable wind slabs could have formed in various aspects. Weak layers have been found in Tröllaskagi and both wet and dry slabs have been falling this weekend in the region. Slabs have also been falling in the Eastfjords as wind slabs have grown in various aspects. A thawing weather on Monday will temporarily compromise snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Unstable wind slabs have formed widely this week. Weak layers are in the snowpack at Tröllaskagi and slabs have been falling in the Eastfjords. Thaw and rain on Monday compromises stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dregur úr éljagangi og vindi á Sunnudag en herðir frost. SSV hvassviðri og úrkoma taka svo við á mánudag með hlýindum sem gætu náð upp til fjalla. Úrkomulaust að mestu á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Uppdated 25.2 15:00. Skier triggered slab in Stafdalur, size 2. A slab avalanche released in Skagafell in Fagridalur 18/2 and wet loose avalanches released in Norðfjörður. Sowmobile triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður 14/2.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Uppdated 25.2 15:00. Skier triggered slab in Stafdalur. Windslabs likely on all aspects after snowfall and snowdrift from variable wind directions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Older snow subsided in warm weather in the first half of the week and weak layers gained strength. Older snow should now be generally stiff and stable. Snow added in mountains on Wednesday and drifted in S-E winds. New unstable wind slabs may have formed in leesides and gullies, on top of the old snow. On Friday, snow fell in NW winds so wind slabs may have formed in more aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow has fallen this week around the country and unstable wind slabs could have formed in various aspects. Weak layers have been found in Tröllaskagi and both wet and dry slabs have been falling this weekend in the region. Slabs have also been falling in the Eastfjords as wind slabs have grown in various aspects. A thawing weather on Monday will temporarily compromise snowpack stability.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Unstable wind slabs have formed widely this week. Weak layers are in the snowpack at Tröllaskagi and slabs have been falling in the Eastfjords. Thaw and rain on Monday compromises stability.

weatherForecast.highlights: N-NV hraglandi fram á laugardagskvöld. Hægur vindur og úrkomu lítið á sunnudag. Gengur í suðlæga átt á mánudag með hlýnandi veðri en ekki mikilli úrkomu
